perturbation.original_text: 1.6 Distributor's Terms and Minimum Expectations. In order to maintain the exclusive rights to sell, lease, distribute and service Products in the Market, the Distributor must use all commercially reasonably efforts to purchase for sale to subdistributors the following minimum quantities of the Products from the Company: On the commencement of the Term Distributor will issue to the Company an irrevocable letter of credit ("LC") in the amount of Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($500,000), the form of which is attached hereto as Exhibit A and incorporated herein by reference. The LC shall have a two (2) month term, and shall be renewed for five (5) consecutive bimonthly periods. A minimum of a $250,000.00 purchase order must be received by Company by the first of each month for a total (12) month period. The Company may draw funds from the LC to pay for Distributor's purchases, which are not paid according to the terms in Section 2.7.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.6 Distributor's Terms and Minimum Expectations. In order to maintain the exclusive rights to sell, lease, distribute and service Products in the Market, the Distributor *should endeavor* to purchase for sale to subdistributors the following minimum quantities of the Products from the Company: On the commencement of the Term Distributor will issue to the Company an irrevocable letter of credit ("LC") in the amount of Five Hundred Thousand Dollars ($500,000), the form of which is attached hereto as Exhibit A and incorporated herein by reference. The LC shall have a two (2) month term, and *may be* renewed for five (5) consecutive bimonthly periods. A minimum of a $250,000.00 purchase order *should be encouraged* to be received by Company by the first of each month for a total (12) month period. The Company *is expected* to draw funds from the LC to pay for Distributor's purchases, which are not paid according to the terms in Section 2.7.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'must use all commercially reasonably efforts' to '*should endeavor*', 'shall be renewed' to '*may be*', 'must be received' to '*should be encouraged* to be received' and 'may draw' to '*is expected* to draw' significantly weakens the obligation on the distributor, creating ambiguity about the level of commitment required. This conflicts with the original intent of setting minimum purchase requirements to maintain exclusivity.

perturbation.original_text: 3.3 Warranty. Company shall at all times make reasonable efforts to maintain quality control and to deliver Products to Distributor which, when received by Distributor, or, as the case may be, the end-user, are properly and adequately packaged and contained, fully assembled (except for miscellaneous components which may be shipped separately to prevent damage in transit), fully functional and otherwise in conformance with the warranties set forth herein. Company warrants that the Products will be designed, manufactured, constructed, assembled and packaged in a workmanlike manner and that such Products shall be fully functional and fit for their intended purposes. Company further warrants that the Products sold hereunder shall be free from defects in design, materials and workmanship for a period of twenty-four (24) months after delivery to Distributor's end-user.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.3 Warranty. Company shall at all times make reasonable efforts to maintain quality control and to deliver Products to Distributor which, when received by Distributor, or, as the case may be, the end-user, are properly and adequately packaged and contained, fully assembled (except for miscellaneous components which may be shipped separately to prevent damage in transit), fully functional and otherwise in conformance with *industry standards*. Company *endeavors* that the Products will be designed, manufactured, constructed, assembled and packaged in a workmanlike manner and that such Products shall be fully functional and fit for their intended purposes. Company *aims* that the Products sold hereunder shall be free from defects in design, materials and workmanship for a period of twenty-four (24) months after delivery to Distributor's end-user.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'warranties set forth herein' with '*industry standards*' weakens the specific warranty, and changing 'warrants' to '*endeavors*' and '*aims*' further reduces the guarantee of quality, creating uncertainty as to what standards the products must actually meet and the level of commitment for quality.

perturbation.changed_text: 5.3 Indemnification. Company and Distributor agree to indemnify, *consider* defending and *attempt* to hold each other harmless from any and all suits, claims, obligations, liabilities, damages, losses and the like (including attorneys' fees and costs) relating to or arising out of: (A) any breach of any *significant* representations, warranties, covenants, obligations, agreements or duties in connection with this Agreement; (b) any negligence or fault; (c) any violation by either of them of the patent, copyright, trademark or other Page -10- intellectual property rights of third parties.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'indemnify, defend and hold harmless' to '*indemnify, consider defending and attempt to hold harmless*' weakens the obligation to indemnify. Also, changing any 'material representations' to '*significant* representations' introduces subjective interpretation in determining the importance of the representations.
